TSP contribution limits will increase again next year, consultants predict
description: This would mark the third straight year that the federal government’s 401(k)-style retirement savings plan and similar private sector programs see a boost in their annual contribution limits.

title: Solving the phased retirement puzzle
description: What can you expect in actual income?

title: Lawmakers urge OPM to expand FEHBP infertility coverage for LGBTQ+ feds
description: A group of 30 congressional Democrats called out “outdated” gaps in how the federal government’s employer-sponsored health insurance program covers infertility treatments, particularly for employees in the LGBTQ+ community.

title: Do you know what your TSP is for?
description: When you were first hired, your retirement benefit may have been described to you as a three-legged stool: pension, Social Security, and TSP savings. One financial planner advises feds not to shortchange the last leg.

title: OPM clarifies pay rules for teleworkers who must travel during work
description: Guidance aimed at stipulating when employees must be paid for their travel to traditional work sites comes ahead of an expected push by agencies to increase the amount of “meaningful in-person work” this fall.

title: How phased retirement works
description: The ins and outs of a program that a lot of feds are curious about.

title: Per diem rates for federal workers will increase this fall, GSA says
description: The standard lodging rate will jump by nearly $10 beginning in October, as the government continues to confront recent inflation.

title: Choke points: Labor historian discusses how public-sector unions took hold
description: Private-sector union strategies and growth have helped public-sector unions and employees.

title: Deadline approaches for Biden’s 5.2% pay raise plan
description: The president must formalize his proposal to give federal employees their largest annual pay increase in more than 40 years by the end of this month, or automatic boosts to locality pay will kick in.

title: IVF coverage is available to veterans under VA insurance — if you’re heterosexual and married
description: A lawsuit filed in federal court would push the agency to cover the treatment — the most effective form of assisted reproductive technology — for people who are single, or who are in LGBTQ+ relationships.

title: Labor Dept. will offer training on new rules to boost some federal contractors' wages
description: Earlier this week, the Biden administration announced a major overhaul of regulations governing the compensation of construction workers on federally funded projects.

description: A further exploration of what’s known as MRA+10.

description: To meet its ambitious staffing goals, watchdog says IRS must start doling out cash.

description: Eight Republican candidates for president shared their ideas for reforming, and shrinking, government.

description: The agency’s culture has been key to its hiring successes, Jen Easterly says.

description: Thirty years ago this month, a landmark piece of legislation aimed to change the very culture of the federal government.

description: Faced with “extremely limited resources" and the same staffing level it had 20 years ago, the NTSB is trying to do more with less.

description: The House and Senate remain significantly divided over spending for the rest of fiscal 2024.

title: Hundreds of federal employees deploy to Hawaii to assist in wildfire response
description: Agencies with offices and personnel on the island are also scrambling to accommodate staff and provide continuity of services.

description: The Postal Service hopes to boost revenue from its largest customers by up to $1.3 billion.

description: Border security, federal firefighter pay and Ukraine aid are part of the emergency request.

title: DeJoy pledges to trim workforce costs as USPS continues to lose more money than expected
description: The Postal Service has found some success in eliminating costs from its network, but overall expenditures spiked in the most recent quarter.

title: The NIH ices a research project. Is it self-censorship?
description: Even though the National Institutes of Health has had to navigate political rapids for decades, including enduring controversy over stem cell research and surveys on the sexual behavior of teens, this is a particularly fraught moment.

title: Proposed contractor climate change rule faces more questions from Republican lawmakers
description: House overseers demand a briefing from acquisition officials on the draft regulation requiring companies doing business with the federal government to report on their greenhouse gas emissions.

title: VA deploys medical units around the country to treat homeless vets
description: The number of homeless veterans has decreased dramatically over the last 15 years.

description: Federal workforce group calls the comments "disqualifying."

title: That time the vast majority of federal employees worked outside Washington
description: That time is now.

title: USPS faces bipartisan pushback as it ramps up consolidation efforts
description: While lawmakers and employees ask the postmaster general to rethink his network changes, the Postal Service is accelerating the reforms.

title: Responsible AI use in support of federal agency missions
description: COMMENTARY︱The potential benefits of artificial intelligence for federal agencies are not a new conversation, but how to implement the technology so officials can achieve the gains they are looking for is worth taking time with.

description: A selection of articles from experts with background to put the newly filed charges in context.

title: House spending bill for the VA renews fight over abortion access, transgender care
description: Legislation would bar Biden administration from closing Guantánamo Bay detention facility in Cuba.

title: Biden grapples with the federal government’s role in a future fraught with extreme heat
description: Heat is a leading killer, but FEMA has not deployed for it as it has for floods and fires.

title: How can senior government leaders best leverage the Federal Employee Viewpoint Survey?
description: COMMENTARY | A lower-than-average employee engagement score may tempt leadership to implement new activities intended to make employees feel happier at work. They should resist this temptation, says one federal executive coach.

title: DHS inspector general pays $1.2M settlement to former deputy
description: Joseph Cuffari has faced widespread allegations of misconduct, though he denies any wrongdoing.

title: Whistleblower alleges government coverup of UFO sightings, recovery efforts
description: Former intelligence official turned whistleblower David Grusch told lawmakers that the federal government has conducted “a multi-decade UAP crash retrieval and reverse engineering program” that has collected “non-human” remains.

title: DEA has regularly hired applicants it flagged as lying on their polygraphs
description: The agency also faces allegations of nepotism in its lie detector testing and a watchdog is saying the issues require "immediate attention" from management.

title: FEMA’s disaster relief fund is running low on cash. What happens now?
description: The Federal Emergency Management Agency’s disaster relief fund is facing at least a $4 billion deficit.

title: DeJoy's USPS overhaul plan might not be carried out well, watchdog finds
description: Postal Service management sharply critiques auditors' findings, saying GAO has a "fundamental misunderstanding" of the agency.

title: The CDC works to overhaul lab operations after COVID test flop
description: A design flaw and contamination during production at the CDC led its initial tests to give false positive results.

title: GAO: USDA violated the Anti-Deficiency Act while planning its relocation of science agencies
description: House Democrats renewed calls to institute tighter regulation of agency relocations in light of the watchdog agency's findings.

title: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau helms multi-agency effort to scrutinize sale of Americans’ data
description: The CFPB and the Federal Trade Commission are teaming up to investigate long-awaited regulatory steps into the sale of Americans’ data by third-party companies.

title: New bill aims to address private sector cyber risks to FEMA operations
description: A proposed amendment to the Homeland Security Act would task FEMA and the Cybersecurity and Infrastructure Security Agency to work with private entities to ensure digital risks to agency operations are mitigated.

title: How the IRS accidentally tagged thousands of taxpayers as dead
description: The IRS confirmed that 6,821 tax accounts were marked as deceased and locked — meaning that the agency wouldn’t process the tax returns associated with it — when the person was, in fact, alive.

title: Maui wildfires: Extra logistical challenges hinder government’s initial response when disasters strike islands
description: How the U.S. government responds to disasters like these and how Maui’s geography could interfere with aid delivery.

title: GAO: IRS must enhance cyber oversight of third-party vendors, modernize online services
description: The IRS continues to ignore GAO’s recommendation to streamline oversight of third-party tax vendors’ cyber practices, despite concerns about mitigating digital threats.

title: Government contractors grapple with enforcement challenges of TikTok ban
description: Industry groups are raising censorship and privacy concerns over a ban of popular social media app TikTok on devices used by government contractors.

title: Federal agencies often neglect U.S. territories. New legislation aims to fix that.
description: The bill would bolster expertise in territories as island communities face increasing threats from climate change.

title: Labor Dept. office rolls back portions of Trump-era policy on handling discrimination claims against contractors
description: Regulations implemented Friday said that a 2020 rule change aimed at making investigations into allegations of discrimination more efficient in practice did the opposite.

title: Stimulus fraud prevention isn’t a lost cause, it’s an opportunity for new tools and techniques
description: COMMENTARY | The lessons learned – and the data – from Paycheck Protection Program fraud can be used to build better models for sifting through fraud data.

title: The most serious Trump indictment yet – a criminal law scholar explains the charges of using ‘dishonesty, fraud and deceit’ to cling to power
description: All of the charges rest on the claim that Trump and his co-conspirators knew the former president lost the 2020 election.

title: Fixing accountability first: Another look at the Restore VA Accountability Act
description: COMMENTARY | If we really want to rid the VA (and the rest of the federal civil service) of poor performers, we need to find a middle ground between making every employee “at will” and defaulting to today’s status quo.

title: House GOP demands info on Biden’s implementation of vaccine mandate for feds
description: A subcommittee is probing several agencies to look for "wrongdoing by government officials" during the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: White House takes a crack at much-needed permitting reform
description: A new rule is the latest push by the Biden administration to address regulatory obstacles to developing clean energy.

title: Is Congress on a witch hunt? 5 ways to judge whether oversight hearings are legitimate or politicized
description: Both Democrats and Republicans have consistently maintained that holding institutions accountable via rigorous oversight is among the most important functions of the legislature, but investigative work can be influenced by partisan considerations.

description: House Republicans hold multiple hearings about immigration at Southern border as part of broader strategy to impeach Alejandro Mayorkas.

description: Freedom Caucus members are urging more support from Speaker McCarthy and GOP leaders.

title: This little-known federal regulator could crack down on fraudulent carbon offsets
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission is "uniquely situated" to stop carbon market manipulation.

description: Legislation would increase accountability, transparency in how federal government helps state, local governments prepare for and respond to public health emergencies.

title: The Agriculture Department is taking a ‘cautious’ approach to generative AI
description: The agency’s data “also needs to be in a condition… to support those kinds of tools,” according to USDA chief data officer and responsible AI officer, Chris Alvares.

title: GSA is looking for participants for its facial recognition study
description: Federal Acquisition Service Commissioner Sonny Hashmi said the study will help determine how to move forward with Login.gov.

title: White House names new deputy chief technology officer for policy
description: Austin Bonner joins White House Office of Science and Technology Policy, though the position of U.S. CTO has not been filled since 2021.

description: Jennifer Hay will lead the Defense Department’s in-house team of software engineers and data scientists.

title: Proposed HIPAA Rule Would Restrict Law Enforcement Access to Abortion, Reproductive Health Data Across State Lines
description: The HHS published a proposed modification to HIPAA’s privacy rule, giving new protections to personal health information related to reproductive care history in the wake of Dobbs and the overturning of Roe v. Wade.

title: VA Paid for But Didn't Deploy an Emergency Communications System
description: Despite spending over $8.5 million on a new emergency communication system contract, a new report has revealed that the Veterans Health Administration failed to establish the network by a deadline that passed more than three years ago.

title: Apple VP Named New Director of Defense Innovation Unit
description: Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin also announced that the Defense Innovation Unit director will report directly to him as part of a leadership “realignment.”

title: Background Investigation IT Systems Software Will Now Be Bought Through One Business
description: Software asset management and purchases for the IT system underpinning security clearance background investigations will be consolidated under a single commercial contractor.

title: Biden Picks Changemaking Air Force Chief as Next Top Military Officer
description: Gen. CQ Brown instituted the “agile combat employment” concept and the “Accelerate Change or Lose” doctrine.

title: Army Mulls 10-20% Cut to Special Operations Forces
description: Lawmakers and Army officials have discussed cuts through decade’s end, including to Green Berets, psyops, and enablers.

title: A ‘Stronger, Faster’ Intelligence Community Is Possible With AI
description: But caution is needed to make sure the technology doesn’t go off the rails.

title: US Military Now Has Voice-Controlled Bug Drones
description: And next year, they might talk back.

title: The Pentagon’s AI Chief Is ‘Scared to Death’ of ChatGPT
description: But other defense leaders are more eager to deploy new artificial-intelligence tools.

title: Where’d the Money Go? Lawmakers Press Air Force on Planned Radar Plane
description: Congress approved $200 million last year to get the first E-7s faster. That’s not happening.

title: Repent Your Abuses of Eavesdropping Law, Lawmakers Tell Intel Agencies
description: House pols want change as agencies seek renewal of FISA’s Section 702.

title: Marines Update Evacuation Playbook
description: A pre-deployment exercise allowed the 26th Marine Expeditionary Unit to practice what they learned from the Afghanistan withdrawal and other non-combatant evacuation operations.

title: The U.S. Space Command Wants Red Phones With China, Russia
description: Global norms and mil-to-mil hotlines are urgently needed as the prospects for war in space rise.

title: The Pentagon Is Increasingly Relying on Billionaires’ Rockets. And It’s OK with That.
description: Space Force leaders say carefully written contracts can prevent things like SpaceX’s about-face on Ukrainian satcomms.

title: Tighten Access to Classified Info, Air Force Secretary Says
description: As the Pentagon responds to a classified document leak, officials should focus on enforcing “need to know,” according to Frank Kendall.

title: Why the Pentagon’s Response to the Discord Leaks Won’t Fix the Problem
description: The Defense Department keeps too many secrets, uses old approaches to secret storage, and does not apply data-driven strategies to classification.

title: US Officials Charge Chinese Agents with Running ‘Secret Police Station’ in NYC
description: Prosecutors unveiled charges Monday against a “troll farm” and Chinese nationals who worked with a Zoom employee to crash meetings with U.S.-based dissidents.

title: 21-Year-Old Air Force IT Specialist Charged With Leaking Classified Security Documents
description: A team of Justice and FBI agents arrested 21-year-old Jack Teixeira in Massachusetts in connection with the widespread intel leak.

title: Military Readiness, the Pentagon and DEI Programs
description: Defense One's Kevin Baron joins the podcast to discuss recruiting.

title: Migrant Deaths in Mexico Put Spotlight on U.S. Policy that Shifted Immigration Enforcement South
description: ‘Extensive use’ of detention led to tragic fire, according to the UN special rapporteur for migrant rights. U.S.-Mexico policy has fueled the growth.

title: Treasury Sanctions Arms Dealer Who Attempted to Broker Deals Between North Korea and Russia
description: A new class of “merchants of death” may be emerging from the Russian war on Ukraine

title: New Federal Website Offers Grants Info and Research to Counter Domestic Terrorism
description: The Homeland Security Department hopes a new website will serve as a one-stop shop for visitors aiming to prevent targeted violence and domestic terrorism with a slew of local and national federal resources.

title: Pentagon’s No. 2 Civilians Fire Back in ‘Woke’ Wars
description: “There's been no detraction from the primary mission,” Navy Undersecretary Erik Raven told dubious GOP senators.

title: Pentagon To Halt Use Of Firefighting Foam That Contains PFAS As Cleanup Costs Mount
description: The Department of Defense will stop purchasing PFAS-containing firefighting foam later this year and phase it out entirely in 2024.

title: Biden Asks the Pentagon to Use Its Buying Power to Advance Gun Safety Goals
description: This is part of a new executive order issued as the president visits a community in California that suffered a mass shooting in January.

title: Pentagon Office Tracking National Security Impact of Silicon Valley Bank Collapse
description: The director of the Pentagon’s office tasked with connecting relevant tech companies with private capital said in an email that the office is “monitoring national security-related impacts” stemming from the prominent startup lender’s demise.

title: Biden Ditches Trump’s Air Force One Paint Scheme For Classic Blue-and-White
description: But the new jets won’t have any polished metal.

title: Biden’s $842B Pentagon Budget Proposal Would Boost New Weapons
description: The spending plan also proposes industrial-base investments.

title: Air Force Must ‘Reintroduce’ Itself to America, Recruiting Service Commander Says
description: Maj. Gen. Ed Thomas says “declining familiarity with who we are” is partly to blame for recruiting problems.

title: Congress Doesn’t Know How to Count the Number of National Security Professionals and That’s a Problem
description: Instead of addressing data security or IT policies around protecting classified information, Congress goes after numbers.

title: Feds Reported ‘Notable Levels’ of Perceived Banned Personnel Practices in 2021
description: This “data is only a starting point, not the finishing line,” said the Merit Systems Protection Board.

title: The End of the Public Health Emergency Means Health Care Changes for Feds
description: Kevin Moss joins the podcast to discuss changes to the Federal Employee Health Benefit Program.

title: Forcing Feds Into the Office Is a Mistake. Here's Why.
description: An arbitrary reduction in telework is likely to drive an exodus of qualified federal workers seeking flexibility to the private sector.

title: Rehiring Federal Retirees 'Makes Sense,' If Agencies Can Get the Go-Ahead
description: Ron Sanders joins the podcast to discuss bringing back feds to federal service.

title: GOP Lawmakers Demand Telework Stats from Federal Agencies
description: Congressional Republicans argued that the Biden administration’s recent efforts to scale back the use of telework are insufficient.

title: New Hiring Methods Help FBI and CIA Combat Cyber Talent Shortage
description: Officials at the intelligence and law enforcement agencies say they’re facing the national cyber talent shortage head-on, from implementing a new approach to hiring top cyber talent to new training programs and incentives.

title: A Default on the U.S. Debt Would Be Far Worse Than a Government Shutdown. Here’s How
description: National security, transportation, Social Security, Medicare and Medicaid would be impacted.

title: The Racial Gap in the Financial Industry
description: Jim Casselberry, CEO and co-founder at Known, joins the podcast to discuss DEI in the banking sector.

title: Federal Labor Law Applies to Civilian Technicians in State National Guards, Supreme Court Affirms
description: The state of Ohio had argued it did not fall under the jurisdiction of the Federal Labor Relations Authority, despite the fact that “dual status technicians” are federal employees.

title: Union and Alaska Army Posts Resolve Differences Over Official Time and Illegal Contract, But Other Fights Remain
description: Despite agreeing to drop the illegal contract the agency unilaterally imposed on AFGE employees in 2019, union officials say management continues to resist the Biden administration’s pro-labor policies.

title: EEOC Alerts Employers to AI Discrimination Risks
description: The agency explains how existing civil rights protections apply to artificial intelligence applications in the workplace.

title: There is No Firm Plan Yet for Feds' Pay in a Debt Ceiling Breach
description: GovExec Senior Correspondent Eric Katz joins the podcast to discuss the ongoing negotiations as a default looms.

title: Pay Raises and Hiring Are Where Lawmakers Agree in DHS Spending BiIl
description: Other common ground on the Homeland Security Department's spending levels is harder to come by.

title: Survey: 45% of Gov Employees May Walk if Agencies Reduce Remote Work Flexibility
description: The survey suggests more than half of government employees prefer to work for an agency that offers hybrid and remote flexibility.

title: Remote Work Has Been Controversial For Decades
description: Tom Shoop joins the podcast to discuss the history of federal telework policy.

title: Could a New COVID Vaccine Offer Lifelong Protection?
description: "We need a better vaccine, one that provides years of robust protection with fewer booster shots against a variety of SARS-CoV-2 strains."

title: Anti-Telework Bill Makes Its Way to the Senate
description: The SHOW UP Act, which narrowly passed the House in February, requires federal agencies to revert to their telework policies prior to the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: The General Schedule is 'Stuck in the Mid-20th Century'
description: The National Academy of Public Administration's Doris Hausser and Kimberly Walton join the podcast to discuss changes to the GS system.

title: From Rescuing Plane Crash Survivors to Preventing Violence, Letter Carriers Recognized for Heroic Actions
description: Two dozen mail men and women earn awards for life-saving courage displayed on the job.

title: Crimes Targeting Mail Carriers Are on the Rise, and USPS Is Taking New Steps to Confront Them
description: Rates of robberies and other mail-related crimes are on pace to far exceed those experienced in 2022.

title: The IRS Answered 2.4M More Taxpayer Phone Calls During 2023 Filing Season
description: Inflation Reduction Act funding paid dividends for the IRS during the 2023 tax filing season.

title: Remote Work Can Bring Tensions, but Managers Can Calm Them
description: Shane Spraggs joins the podcast to discuss how organizations can successfully implement telework.

title: Feds Could Be Fired at Any Time for Any Reason, Under a Bill That Was Just Reintroduced
description: The bill also would abolish the Merit Systems Protection Board and threatens to reduce former federal employees’ retirement benefits if they file “frivolous” appeals of adverse personnel actions.

title: Biden Deploys Thousands to the Border, and Some of the New Assignments Aren't Optional
description: At least some staff at the departments of Homeland Security and Defense are facing mandatory assignments as an expected migrant surge strains resources.

title: A New Retirement Resource
description: OPM offers a five-step guide to the sometimes confusing retirement process.

title: A Labor Economist Predicts Stability in the Fed Pay Trendline, But With a Big Caveat
description: “There is always a long lag between when higher inflation starts to eat into a fed paycheck and when that paycheck starts to respond to inflation,” one compensation expert says.

title: A New Guide to the Retirement Process Could Help Feds Avoid Pitfalls, Manage Expectations
description: OPM's new three-page guide to the federal retirement process will be updated on a monthly basis to reflect anticipated wait times for federal retirees to begin receiving their annuity payments.

title: Your Guide to Virtual Retirement Resources
description: Advances in technology have made it easier to get educated on federal retirement benefits without leaving your computer.

title: Fed Health Care Changes and the End of the COVID-19 Public Health Emergency
description: Some over-the-counter and out-of-network coverage may be different now that the pandemic emergency is over.

title: Fight the Long-Running FEHBP Abortion Ban, Gender Equity Group Urges House Democrats
description: The Department of Justice Gender Equality Network said the Hyde amendment unfairly makes women’s health care decisions more costly and traumatic, even when covered by exceptions in cases of rape, incest or the health of the mother.

title: Fed Pay and Benefits Could be Hit Hard by Debt Ceiling Wheeling and Dealing
description: There are a few scenarios that could be bad for federal workers in the debt ceiling negotiations.

title: Mandatory Overtime at VA Is Not Going Away Any Time Soon, Though Officials Acknowledge It's a Problem
description: It is all hands on deck as VA looks to handle a surge of new work.

title: Pay Cuts Have Rural Letter Carriers ‘Scared’ and ‘Outraged’
description: DeJoy says the situation is “unfortunate” but wasn't his decision and “it is what it is.”

title: Federal Prison Employees Ask the Supreme Court to Review COVID Hazard Pay Case
description: Attorneys for nearly 200 U.S. Bureau of Prisons workers in Connecticut said a federal appellate court effectively made it impossible for any federal worker to qualify for hazard pay related to “virulent biologicals” with its interpretation of federal regulations.

title: Social Security Facts and Myths
description: How much do you know about these key retirement benefits?

title: Congressional Dems Reintroduce Bill to Revamp Federal Firefighter Pay and Benefits
description: The Tim Hart Wildland Firefighter Classification and Pay Parity Act would ensure federal wildland firefighters make at least $20 per hour, among other things.

title: Ditch Salary History When Setting Job Applicants’ Pay, OPM Proposes
description: Aimed at reducing gender- and ethnicity-based pay gaps, the initiative would also apply tighter guard rails in cases when an applicant has a competing and higher-paying job offer.

title: 'Benefits Envy' May Be Partly to Blame for the Erosion of Fed Compensation
description: “The sense that public employees have stuff that’s better” than that of private-sector workers persists, says one expert.

title: Thank the People Who Make Sure You Get Your Benefits
description: Public Service Recognition Week is a good time to honor those who created and those who maintain the federal retirement system.

title: TSP Returns Stayed Mostly Positive for April
description: All but one of the five individual funds in the retirement savings program grew for the month, and all were in the black so far for the year.

title: TSP’s G Fund and The Debt Ceiling
description: When the government suspends reinvestments in the G Fund while it shores up its finances, one expert argues they should account for the missed payments separately from actual returns.

title: OPM Tests Chatbot For Retirement Services
description: The retirement services chatbot is designed to answer easy questions to free up call center resources for more complex inquiries.

title: The Best Age for Retirement
description: It’s not the same for everybody.

title: Pay and Prestige For Civil Servants: The Historical Advantages—and Disadvantages—of Government Work
description: The advantages have “helped to recruit and keep some very good people in government work,” according to one academic.

title: The TSP Wouldn’t Be Affected By McCarthy’s Plan to Raise the Debt Ceiling and Cut Spending
description: The House could vote on the plan later this week.

title: What Feds Need to Know About Getting the Most Out of the TSP
description: Abraham Grungold joins the podcast to discuss his decades of experience with the Thrift Savings Plan.

title: Getting Credit for Your Work
description: Carefully documenting previous military or civilian service can lead to an earlier retirement and a bigger benefit.

title: From Wildland Firefighters to Defense Language Instructors, Sometimes The Pay Is Way Too Low
description: Defense Language Institute employees are now in a pitched struggle to gain better pay.

title: Feds Could Soon See Better Child Care Options Under a New Executive Order
description: A plan to revamp federal employees’ access to child care came Tuesday as part of a broad effort by President Biden to improve the affordability of care services for children and adult family members, as well as boost care workers’ compensation.

title: Secretary Haaland Highlights Collaborative Conservation in the Face of the Climate Crisis at United Nations 2023 Water Conference
description: Today on World Water Day, Secretary Haaland delivered the national statement on behalf of the United States at the United Nations 2023 Water Conference in New York City.

title: In Oregon, Secretary Haaland Highlights Investments in Wildland Fire and Outdoor Recreation Economies
description: Secretary Haaland was in Oregon this weekend to highlight Biden-Harris administration investments to support wildland fire preparedness, water management and outdoor recreation opportunities across the state.

title: Secretary Haaland Announces Nearly $50 Million for Wildfire Mitigation and Resilience from Bipartisan Infrastructure Law
description: Today, Interior announced nearly $50 million in new allocations from the Bipartisan Infrastructure Law to support wildland fire management in fiscal year 2023.
